DOC.brief_summary: The objective of this study is to evaluate clinical outcomes following sub-2 mm micro-incision cataract surgery (MICS) and intraocular lens (IOL) implantation. This study is evaluated in two Phases - V4 (6M) endpoint: primary analysis - V5 (12M) and V6 (34M): EPCO score and Nd Yag incidence analysis
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation of Clinical Outcomes Following Implantation of a Sub-2mm Hydrophilic MICS Intraocular Lens
DOC.criteria: Subjects must have clear intraocular media other than cataract in the study eye. Subjects must have a clinically documented diagnosis of agerelated cataract that is considered amenable to treatment with microincision phacoemulsification cataract extraction in the study eye. Subjects with ocular malformation in the study eye. Subjects who have had previous surgery in the study eye. Subjects with uncontrolled glaucoma in either eye. Subjects with any anterior segment pathology for which microincision phacoemulsification cataract surgery would be contraindicated Subjects using medications known to potentially complicate cataract surgery.
